intro: Varronia integrifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that can grow up to 10 meters tall. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are entire and glossy green in color. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and appear in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native habitat.
